↳ In-reply-to ¬ª it is said #activitypub is too complex. I personnaly prefer #twtxt for simplicity, and even more #feeds like #atom or rss to follow someone

Also #activitypub based ‚Äúsocial platforms‚Äù tend to form a ‚Äúdistributed network‚Äù, as opposed to a ‚Äúdecentralised‚Äù one like what we have here with Yarn.social / Twtxt üëå (even if things are a little slower, by design‚Ä¶)

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Hi Everyone! For the month of February @prologic and I are donating our beer budget to the yarn.social collective!! We would love for the yarn community to join us in not only ‚Äòdry February‚Äô but also making a financial donation. Funds collected will be used to pay a mobile developer to help build the mobile app! (@prologic can speak to these tech goals)

@kt84 Thanks! üôá‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Although I‚Äôm not really that keen on no more üç∫ for a month! Oh well ü§£ ‚Äì To clarify, (though I haven‚Äôt been as vocal/public about this as I should have been), my goals for this year are two-fold:

  • Get the Yarn.social mobile app complete and finally released to the App and Play stores. There is a Release milestone that covers what needs to be done. I‚Äôm anticipating this to take around 1-2 months at a cost of around $800-$~1600 USD.

My second goal, once this is complete is to get the Salty.im mobile app actually off the ground and at a bare minimum it should sport features that let you chat with individuals, group chats and push notifications. @xuu@txt.sour.is has been hard at work working on Double Ratcheting support (more secure!) whilst I‚Äôve been working on the Broker and API and Blob storage.

Hi Everyone! For the month of February @prologic and I are donating our beer budget to the yarn.social collective!! We would love for the yarn community to join us in not only ‚Äòdry February‚Äô but also making a financial donation. Funds
collected will be used to pay a mobile developer to help build the mobile app! (@prologic can speak to these tech goals)

@kt84 Thanks! üôá‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Although I‚Äôm not really that keen on no more üç∫ for a month! Oh well ü§£ ‚Äì To clarify, (though I haven‚Äôt been as vocal/public about this as I should have been), my goals for this year are two-fold:

Get the Yarn.social mobile app complete and finally released to the App and Play stores. There is a Release milestone that covers what needs to be done. I‚Äôm anticipating this to take around 1-2 months at a cost of around $800-$~1600 USD.


My second goal, once this is complete is to get the Salty.im mobile app actually off the ground and at a bare minimum it should sport features that let you chat with individuals, group chats and push notifications. @xuu@txt.sour.is has been hard at work working on Double Ratcheting support (more secure!) whilst I‚Äôve been working on the Broker and API and Blob storage.

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Okay so I have no clue about Rust nor am I a very proficient programmer, but surely this is even more of a joke than this repo portrays it to be? It can't actually be this ridiculous to make a hello world in Rust surely üòÖ

@eldersnake@we.loveprivacy.club I‚Äôm afraid it is really ü§£

A ‚ÄúHello World‚Äù in Go is just:

$ go mod init hello
$ cat > main.go <<EOF
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello World")
}
$ go build
$ ./hello
Hello World

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Pod / System update: there does seem to have been some data loss as a result of the recent re-homing of this service ‚Äì including the warning issued from this account many hours prior! ‚Äì but I'm hoping that, overall, the process hasn't been catastrophic; please do let me know if you have experienced any issues, or indeed still are. Ta!

@jlj@twt.nfld.uk Hmmm, to be honest I‚Äôm not sure how you‚Äôd have lost any data at all really. ü§î Can you elaborate on what you think you lost, maybe point me to a twt you think has gone missing or something? I mean there‚Äôs an in-memory cache, that is synced to disk periodically (and on shutdown), but the cache is really ephemeral anyway, it is populated by fetching feeds. Then there‚Äôs the on-disk archive, which really shouldn‚Äôt suffer any data loss, as it‚Äôs only ever written once.
